title: Large-Scale Online Education Based on Self-Monitoring for Improving Korean Pronunciation

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Hangul (Korean alphabet) phonemic system and basic pronunciation principles
context.additional_context: Blended learning combining real-time lectures and online assignments, utilizing digital devices

learning_goals: Learners can pronounce Korean syllables by applying lateralization and nasalization rules at syllable boundaries with over 80% accuracy.
Learners independently monitor their pronunciation using recording and voice analysis tools and perform three or more correction cycles.
Learners achieve a 25% or greater improvement in pronunciation intelligibility metrics based on pre- and post-assessment comparisons.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
